On one hand, I believe in fairness and equality, and I don't want to gain an unfair advantage over someone else just because of our cultural background or skin color. However, as a fashion designer, I know that my style and trends can greatly influence the industry, and this is where my confidence kicks in.

My desire is to use this situation to promote diversity and inclusivity in the fashion world, which aligns with my passion for fashion and my values. I want to prove that no matter who you are or where you come from, your unique perspective and skills can make a difference.

With an intention to learn from someone with a different background and experience, I will take this opportunity to broaden my horizons and gain a new understanding of the world. I am willing to share my knowledge and expertise to create a more level playing field for everyone.

Finally, I will give 5 dollars

The experiment is going to be quite interesting, isn't it? I'm not sure what to expect from my partner, but I'm always up for a challenge.

As I reflect on this opportunity, I want to share with you what's driving my decision. You see, as a fashion designer and someone who believes in promoting diversity and inclusivity, I have always been passionate about creating spaces where people can feel seen and celebrated.

My desire to be part of this experiment is not just about the money; it's about understanding how to break down barriers and create connections across different backgrounds. I truly believe that we can learn a lot from each other, even in the face of uncertainty.

Now, when it comes to giving money to my partner, my intention is to show kindness and openness. I want to start with an equal gesture because I don't know what our shared values or interests are yet. If the choice were mine alone, I might give a larger amount since it aligns with my values of generosity and equality.

However, considering we're in a setting where giving less could spark interesting conversations about financial disparities and cultural differences, I'm choosing to keep things fair but thoughtful.

Finally, I will give $5.
